reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: Maailma.net's Advances of development is a communications project implemented by the means of journalism and social media. Its aim is to increase interest knowledge and discussion on the progress that has been achieved recently in developing countries. The article sets published in the projet communicate how problems have been solved and how the progress has affected people's lives. Challenges regarding developing countries are not forgotten ? still the emphasis is on solutions. The goal is to tear down the myth that there has been no advancements in developing countries and that development cooperation hasn't been of any use.The core of the project is a high quality series of article sets implemented by journalistic principles. They discuss the advances of development by using expert interviews development studies and Finnish development cooperation projects. The article sets are published in their own visual environment on maailma.net. Maailma.net is a civil society's news website published by the Finnish O neWorld Association. Every year about 1000 edited journalistic articles on development cooperation and sustainable development are published on it. Maailma.net has about 15000 readers per month. It's the only Finnishn independent news website concentrated on development and development policies. The 40 article sets of the project consist of text pictures videos and statistical visualizations and for that the website is updated technically. They are distributed and marketed via a newsletter and a separate so cial media campaign. Its effectiveness is measured by f. ex. with the help of a reader panel. The target group are Finnish people who are interested in contemporary phenomena especially young people.The need of the project arises from the recent public dis cussion. Conflicts and crises have intensified and populist cricisim of development cooperation has become more common. That's why many news regarding developing countries are negative. The Finns' knowledge of development is also weak and they need more in formation. That has been perceived for example in the surveys of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.A total of 90 000 euro grant application has been given to this two-year project by MoFA.
